DataElement.preferredName: Nonmetastatic Primary Breast Neoplasm Negation Pathologic Complete Response Surgery Evidence Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the evidence of non-metastatic primary breast cancer showing evidence of non pathological complete response at surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nonmetastatic Primary Breast Neoplasm Negation Pathologic Complete Response Surgery Evidence Nonmetastatic Primary Breast Neoplasm
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the evidence of non-metastatic primary breast cancer showing evidence of non pathological complete response at surgery._Cancer that has not spread from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body._Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma. It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue. Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that has not spread from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma. It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue. Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males.

Concepts.definition: Cancer that has not spread from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma. It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue. Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males.

Property.preferredName: Negation Pathologic Complete Response Surgery Evidence
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.:The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.:Knowledge on which to base belief.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
Knowledge on which to base belief.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: On this side, is there non-me
ReferenceDocuments.description: On this side, is there non-metastatic primary breast cancer showing evidence of non pCR at surgery and sentinel lymph node biopsy alone if negative OR positive sentinel lymph node biopsy followed by axillary nodal clearance
